title: Works by Gunnar Asplund
introduction: Erik Gunnar Asplund created numerous influential buildings throughout Sweden. His work spans from early Nordic Classicism to later Functionalist designs.

projects.name: Stockholm Public Library
projects.description: One of Asplund's most famous works, featuring a cylindrical main hall with books arranged in tiers around the walls.

projects.name: Woodland Cemetery (Skogskyrkogården)
projects.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site designed with Sigurd Lewerentz, blending architecture and landscape into a unified whole.

projects.name: Stockholm Exhibition
projects.description: A significant exhibition of functionalist architecture that became influential in establishing the Swedish modern style.

otherProjects.heading: Other Notable Projects
otherProjects.content: Asplund's portfolio includes numerous other buildings such as the Skandia Cinema, Göteborg Law Courts extension, and the Woodland Crematorium.

influence.heading: Architectural Influence
influence.content: Asplund's work represents a distinctive blend of classicism and modernism that influenced generations of architects in Sweden and beyond.
